Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and quickly check emails for any urgent requests. Catch up on any market news that might affect our fund strategy. Briefly browse Reddit (r/wallstreetbets) for the lulz.

Review the list of goals for the week. Begin researching best practices for accounting policies and procedures specific to market-neutral statistical arbitrage funds. Check the SEC website for relevant guidelines.
Draft an initial outline for the fund's accounting policies. Include sections on revenue recognition, expense allocation, valuation of securities, and reporting requirements.

Email @comp-1 (Compliance Officer) and @legal-1 (Legal Counsel) to schedule a meeting to discuss the draft accounting policies and ensure compliance with all relevant regulations. Topic: Review of draft accounting policies.
Lunch break. Head out for a quick bite with colleagues. Probably grab some fast food.
Meeting with @comp-1 and @legal-1 to discuss the drafted accounting policies. Take detailed notes and address any concerns raised. Make revisions to the draft as needed.

Begin researching and evaluating different accounting software options suitable for tracking fund performance and expenses. Focus on solutions that offer robust reporting capabilities and integration with trading platforms.
Browse online demos and read reviews of potential accounting software options. Shortlist the top three candidates for further evaluation.
Wrap up for the day. Respond to any outstanding emails and prepare a to-do list for tomorrow.
